title: Russia offers 2 lakh rubles as signing bonus to fight Ukraine war
content: Russia offered financial incentives, including a 195,000 ruble signing bonus and monthly salaries up to 400,000 rubles, to attract new military recruits. The government also appealed to patriotism. This effort aims to counteract manpower shortages amidst ongoing military operations in Ukraine since February 2022.
summary: Russia offered financial incentives, including a 195,000 ruble signing bonus and monthly salaries up to 400,000 rubles, to attract new military recruits. The government also appealed to patriotism. This effort aims to counteract manpower shortages amidst ongoing military operations in Ukraine since February 2022.

title: Southwest Airlines to discontinue open seating policy
content: Southwest Airlines is ending its open seating policy after 50 years, shifting to assigned seating and premium rows. The company cites evolving customer preferences and the need to attract corporate travelers. This change follows pressure from Elliott Investment Management and reflects unsuccessful summer ticket sales affecting profits. Additionally, Southwest will introduce red-eye flights on five routes starting February to boost revenue.
summary: Southwest Airlines is ending its open seating policy after 50 years, shifting to assigned seating and premium rows. The company cites evolving customer preferences and the need to attract corporate travelers. This change follows pressure from Elliott Investment Management and reflects unsuccessful summer ticket sales affecting profits. Additionally, Southwest will introduce red-eye flights on five routes starting February to boost revenue.

title: Deployment of UAE's Mirage fighters bombers in China raises concerns in US
content: The UAE Air Force and China's PLAAF held a joint exercise in Xinjiang, involving Mirage 2000-9 fighter bombers. The event raised US concerns about China getting access to Western military technology. It pointed to stronger UAE-China ties and significant geopolitical shifts. The UAE's inclining towards China had shown Washington about the UAE's level of independence.
summary: The UAE Air Force and China's PLAAF held a joint exercise in Xinjiang, involving Mirage 2000-9 fighter bombers. The event raised US concerns about China getting access to Western military technology. It pointed to stronger UAE-China ties and significant geopolitical shifts. The UAE's inclining towards China had shown Washington about the UAE's level of independence.

title: Catfight in US over childbearing and abortion as election campaign heats up
Not only 'cat ladies', JD Vance once said childless people should not have....
content: Donald Trump's running mate JD Vance's childless cat ladies comment targeting Kamala Harris, Pete Buttigieg and AOC has struck all the wrong chords as the Republican leader is facing a volley of criticism from all quarters -- Jennifer Anniston being the latest. Now another clip has emerged on social media highlighting JD Vance's stand on childless people.
summary: Donald Trump's running mate JD Vance's childless cat ladies comment targeting Kamala Harris, Pete Buttigieg and AOC has struck all the wrong chords as the Republican leader is facing a volley of criticism from all quarters -- Jennifer Anniston being the latest. Now another clip has emerged on social media highlighting JD Vance's stand on childless people.

title: Yes, Kamala Harris' first campaign video has Beyonce's 'Freedom'
content: Kamala Harris Thursday released the first video of her presidential campaign and it featured Beyonce's song Freedom. CNN earlier reported that Harris' team reached out to Beyonce to get approval to use that song throughout her presidential campaign. And it was allowed. Quickly.
summary: Kamala Harris Thursday released the first video of her presidential campaign and it featured Beyonce's song Freedom. CNN earlier reported that Harris' team reached out to Beyonce to get approval to use that song throughout her presidential campaign. And it was allowed. Quickly.

title: Jailed Imran Khan to run for Oxford University Chancellor post? Internet can't keep calm
content: Pakistan's former prime minister Imran Khan is reportedly planning to apply for the position of the chancellor at Oxford University after the post became vacant following the resignation of Lord Patten. Imran Khan is in jail on charges of inciting protests and violence against the military last year. Reports said Imran Khan's team cited public demand that he should contest but it will be a tough one as Boris Johnson, Tony Blair -- the former UK PMs -- are also in the race.
summary: Pakistan's former prime minister Imran Khan is reportedly planning to apply for the position of the chancellor at Oxford University after the post became vacant following the resignation of Lord Patten. Imran Khan is in jail on charges of inciting protests and violence against the military last year. Reports said Imran Khan's team cited public demand that he should contest but it will be a tough one as Boris Johnson, Tony Blair -- the former UK PMs -- are also in the race.

title: Climate protest at Frankfurt Airport forces a temporary halt to flights
content: Environmental activists disrupted air travel at Frankfurt Airport by breaching security fences, leading to the cancellation of over 100 flights. The demonstrations aimed to highlight the urgent need to address climate change caused by fossil fuel use. Similar protests occurred across Europe, targeting airports in Finland, Norway, Switzerland, and Spain. Legal actions were planned against the activists.
summary: Environmental activists disrupted air travel at Frankfurt Airport by breaching security fences, leading to the cancellation of over 100 flights. The demonstrations aimed to highlight the urgent need to address climate change caused by fossil fuel use. Similar protests occurred across Europe, targeting airports in Finland, Norway, Switzerland, and Spain. Legal actions were planned against the activists.

title: Why does Nepal suffer so many air crashes?
content: Eighteen people lost their lives in a Kathmandu plane crash, underscoring Nepalâ€™s air safety issues. The country's difficult terrain, outdated aircraft, and inadequate pilot training contribute to frequent incidents. Although the European Union had banned Nepal's airlines since 2013, improvements in aviation regulation have been observed recently.
summary: Eighteen people lost their lives in a Kathmandu plane crash, underscoring Nepalâ€™s air safety issues. The country's difficult terrain, outdated aircraft, and inadequate pilot training contribute to frequent incidents. Although the European Union had banned Nepal's airlines since 2013, improvements in aviation regulation have been observed recently.

title: Putin vows 'retribution' against those trying to 'divide' Russia
content: Putin has escalated a decades-long crackdown on civil society, independent media and opposition amid his military offensive in Ukraine, with dissent and criticism of the Kremlin outlawed and punishable by years-long prison sentences.
summary: Putin has escalated a decades-long crackdown on civil society, independent media and opposition amid his military offensive in Ukraine, with dissent and criticism of the Kremlin outlawed and punishable by years-long prison sentences.

title: Death toll from Ethiopia landslides expected to rise to 500, UN says
content: Landslides in Ethiopia have caused 257 deaths, potentially rising to 500, as reported by the UN. Government and community-led rescue efforts are in full swing in Gofa, Southern Ethiopia. Over 15,000 individuals are at risk and require urgent evacuation, including children and pregnant women.
summary: Landslides in Ethiopia have caused 257 deaths, potentially rising to 500, as reported by the UN. Government and community-led rescue efforts are in full swing in Gofa, Southern Ethiopia. Over 15,000 individuals are at risk and require urgent evacuation, including children and pregnant women.

title: 'Shame on you': Brutal video of UK cop stomping on manâ€™s head at Manchester Airport sparks protest
content: A shocking video showing a British police officer kicking a manâ€™s head at Manchester Airport sparked a protest. Protesters marched to the airport and chanted "shame on you GMP". The Greater Manchester Police suspended one officer and referred the case to an independent watchdog. Protesters demanded justice, marching to a police station. The arrested men were suspected of multiple assaults, and the incident concluded without further violence.
summary: A shocking video showing a British police officer kicking a manâ€™s head at Manchester Airport sparked a protest. Protesters marched to the airport and chanted "shame on you GMP". The Greater Manchester Police suspended one officer and referred the case to an independent watchdog. Protesters demanded justice, marching to a police station. The arrested men were suspected of multiple assaults, and the incident concluded without further violence.

title: Germany, UK sign deal to boost military ties
content: The statement came as UK defense secretary John Healey visited Berlin to hold talks with his German counterpart, Boris Pistorius.
summary: The statement came as UK defense secretary John Healey visited Berlin to hold talks with his German counterpart, Boris Pistorius.

title: How Doug Emhoffâ€™s ex-wife defended Kamala Harris amid 'childless' attack
Explainer: Outrage in China over retirement age reform
'Barely understandable': Donald Trump reacts to US President Joe Bidenâ€™s Oval Office speech
Placard reading 'war criminal', 'guilty of genocide' shown by US lawmaker during Netanyahu's speech
content: Democratic representative Rashida Tlaib, who is the only Palestinian-American member of Congress held up signs reading "war criminal" and "guilty of genocide", during Netanyahu's speech. She also wore a Palestinian flag pin and a keffiyeh, the black and white scarf linked with the Palestinian struggle for over half a century.
summary: Democratic representative Rashida Tlaib, who is the only Palestinian-American member of Congress held up signs reading "war criminal" and "guilty of genocide", during Netanyahu's speech.
